level.heading: LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES[COLON] CERTIFICATE OF ORGANIZATION FOR COMPANIESITH ONE OR MORE SERIES (§ 17-747)

level.text: In addition to the requirements of Chapter 8 (Limited Liability Companies) of the Act (D.C. Official Code § 29-801.01 et seq. (2011 Repl.)), if a limited liability company has one (1) or more series that is treated as a separate entity, the certificate of organization filed with the Superintendent shall include:
That the limited liability company has at least one (1) member;
The date on which the person(s) became the company’s initial member or members; and
The name of the company’s initial member or members.
